Chicago and as important as the website

first was that we were going to retweet
content
elated to channel for mayor as well as

about just news about chance in kind of
this political light kind of in the way
that you would see a real campaign do
and then the second component was that
we were going to have a Twitter bot
where people could interact with us and
make memes about Chano for mayor these
are what some of the memes looks like
the basic idea of it was that people
would tweet at us they would mention us
we would have a little bot that would
automatically grab a Creative Commons
license image and put their text on top
with some random emojis and then that
would send us an email alert and we
could go in and reply to that person
with the image that they generated we
could have made it fully automatic but
we decided not to because we've seen the
horrible things that happen to bots on
Twitter and we knew that it was like
important that there was a human screen
here so that we could kind of direct
lightly the way that the conversation
was happening I don't think that we

and and it was something that we thought
pretty deliberately about so the website

yeah we were pretty surprised because we

project was really really simple and I

idea that we had the second lesson is
that narrative art is really important
to a project and I think this applies
even projects that do have really cool
check you should think about what people
gut impression is going to be of your
